result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua R Petrie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court order all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges waived due to low income.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua R Petrie

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joshua R Petrie in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Joshua R Petrie in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    The Court ordered the Defendant to serve  SIX MONTHS  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 172  days time served.  COURT ORDER ALL mandatory costs, fees and surcharges waived due to low income.   Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Joshua R Petrie not in court, in custody.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
On motion of the STate, Court set bail in the amount of $100.00 cash with TOT to Justice Point for monitoring if posted.

Defendant Joshua R Petrie in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Joshua R Petrie in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties in receipt of doctor's report indicating defendant is now found competent. All parties stipulate to the findings.   Court orders proceedings reinstated.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Order to Produce
Report from WCS dated 09/14/2015 regarding the defendant's transportation status received and filed.

Defendant Joshua R Petrie in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Joshua R Petrie in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

 The court finds the defendant not competent to proceed but likely to become competent within the statutory time period.  if provided with appropriate treatment, is likely to become competent within 9 months or within the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less. Court ordered involuntary medication for the defendant.  The court orders the proceedings suspended and committed the defendant to the Department of Health Services for an indeterminate term not to exceed 9 months, or the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less.  Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed and filed.
Case adjourned to 11-24-2015  at 8:30 a.m. for review hearing  in Branch 47.  Review hearing scheduled for 11-24-2015 at 08:30 am.
Doctor's report received. lr
Doctor's report from Mendota Mental Health  received and filed. lr

Defendant Joshua R Petrie in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Joshua R Petrie in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties in receipt of doctor's report that was inconclusive, defendant was uncooperative. Court ordered defendant to be transported by the Sheriff's dept. to Mendota for an inpatient evaluation.  Defendant continues to be remanded .
  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for 08-28-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joshua R Petrie in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties in receipt of doctor's report. Defense is challenging the report. Court called Dr. Pankiewicz and scheduled a competency hearing. lr
  Competency hearing scheduled for 08-06-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Joshua R Petrie not in court, in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defense counsel informs the court that he believes that the defendant is not competent to proceed. Pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2) Wis. Stats., Court ordered defendant to be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit  Order For Competency Examination, signed and filed. Copy forwarded to the Forensic Unit. Court ordered case adjourned for doctor report return in Branch 47. Court ordered defendant remanded into custody.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for 07-15-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received and FIled, Justice Point VIOLATION Report; Missed Office Contact.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with: Gabriel M; Scott Y.

Defendant Joshua R Petrie in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  
Defendant Joshua R Petrie in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice point discharge report received and filed. lr
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($500.00 signature bond) ad
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT. lr

Attorney Michael Jude in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT. lr

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No VIOLENT Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SCOTT Y. AND GABRIEL M. AND ONLY RELATED TO THEIR PROFESSIONAL DUTIES.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Joshua R Petrie in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Joshua R Petrie in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
